meanings.sent1: The teacher's explanation was just bafflegabs to the students.

meanings.definition: To confuse or bewilder with incomprehensible language.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to bafflegabs the audience with his long-winded speech.
meanings.sent2: She used technical jargon to bafflegabs her opponents during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The magician used misdirection to bafflegabs the audience's sense of reality.
meanings.sent4: The complex instructions seemed designed to bafflegabs even the most experienced builders.
meanings.sent5: His elaborate excuse only served to bafflegabs his parents further.
